![https://i.imgur.com/WvjGsyG.gifv](https://i.imgur.com/WvjGsyG.gif)

**Steps to reproduce:**

2. Select it
3. Delete it
4. Selection rectangle is still in the editor viewport

**Link to minimal example project:**
<!-- Optional but very welcome. You can drag and drop a zip archive to upload it. -->

data.title: Add scale parameter for some draw methods?
data.body:
Example:
```
void draw_string( Font font, Vector2 pos, String text, Color modulate=Color(1,1,1,1), int clip_w=-1, Vector2 scale)
Draw a string using a custom font.
```

Could also be added for other draw methods (draw_style_box, draw_texture)

For example, implementing damage numbers, the developer shouldn't really be using hundreds of cached sprites, or duplicating node2d just to take advantage of the scaling.

Instead, creating a `damage_numbers` array and simply populating it and using `draw_string` is far better on performance in comparison. Especially when hundreds of numbers are being dynamically generated while in combat / 6 + players in map

And with the scale parameter, it would let developers create cool pop in number effects

data.title: Removed transparency from spatial editor grid.
data.body:
grid transparency caused some problems, with transparent objects, so it was removed, as a consequence it is not possible to use alpha values for the grid color, disabling the 'fading' grid : (

this is how it looks with this PR

![screenshot from 2017-09-24 17-33-05](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1103897/30787894-9921db04-a158-11e7-883a-9cbe795f5024.png)

![screenshot from 2017-09-24 17-31-18](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1103897/30787897-a08f4dea-a158-11e7-80db-c04e886bd2bf.png)


also, it is not visible in the screenshots but i removed the blue cursor at the center, @reduz are you okay with this?

closes #11479 
closes #11475

data.title: Camera zoom acts weirdly with Parallax Background, whether "Ignore Camera Zoom" is set ornot
data.body:
Project file demonstrating issue:
[parallaxScale.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/1327776/parallaxScale.zip)
Left/Right- Scrolls left and right
Up/Down- Zooms in and out.


Actions:
1) Set up ParallaxBackground with child ParallaxLayers. Set up a camera and make sure you can change its position and zoom level. Center camera on Background.

2) Change the zoom of the camera in and out. 

Expected: When you first zoom in and out, the scene should stay the same only with your view expanding to see more of the scene. In other words, it should be like you're zooming out from the background.

Actual: The entire background "shrinks" to the top left corner of the screen, away from the center of the camera.



Action 2: Turn on "Ignore Camera Zoom", and zoom in and out again.

Expected: I'm not actually sure, but it should stay more or less the same.

Actual: The scene wobbles and acts funny.

data.title: Syntax highlight for the $ get node synatax.
data.body:
Currently when using $ to get a node, the node's name is highlighted with the default syntax highlighting, which can make it inconsistent with default node names
![](https://i.imgur.com/JxQ2Uy9.png)
The word after the $ should have its own color to differentiate it from other things in the code.

data.title: Fix Variant::get_named return when p_index is invalid
Fix Dictionary set_named

Reduz optimized field indexing in 3c85703 but the changes didn't apply
to dictionary so this code remained untouched. However, the logic for
validity checking was changed but not updated for the dictionary case.

This fixes #11543

data.title: AnimationPlayer doesn't update material parameter if material is changed at runtime
data.body:
**Operating system or device, Godot version, GPU Model and driver (if graphics related):**
Windows 7
Godot 3.0 from master
Geforce GTX 760

**Issue description:**
Since materials/shaders are shared across instances (I believe? or at least the mesh they're on) when instancing scenes that use materials that have parameters you want to animate using an AnimationPlayer, I've found you have to duplicate the material so that it's unique. If you don't do this, then the other instances end up being affected. 

In 2.x I got around this issue by duplicating the material so that it was unique, but the same method doesn't seem to work in 3.0. Even though the path to the parameter the animation player is animating exists, it doesn't seem to affect the newly applied (at runtime) material. Perhaps it's still referencing the original material and updating that instead?


**Steps to reproduce:**
Download and run the project I've attached
Click the 'Duplicate Material' button on the screen, the ball on the right should stop pulsing red.

**Link to minimal example project:**
[animation_material_bug.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/1327478/animation_material_bug.zip)

data.title: Removing viewport world causes get_frustum() to fail and spatial audio playback to crash in the editor
data.body:
**Operating system or device, Godot version, GPU Model and driver (if graphics related):**
Windows 7
Godot 3.0 from master
GTX 760

**Issue description:**
Kind of two issues here, but they are related and one lead to me finding the other. I've noticed this problem (get_frustum errors) with 2.x before, but the editor crash was a new one in 3.0

I'll try and explain it as best I can.

Basically, the problem happens when you set the world parameter on a viewport (which has a child camera), clear it, save and then close the scene.

When the scene is re-opened, everything will appear fine, but if you then create a new blank scene or open up any other scene, you'll get the following error every time the editor camera updates:

scene/3d/camera.cpp:601 - Condition ' !is_inside_world() ' is true. Returned: Vector<Plane>()

This was annoying as it slowed down the editor a bit, but it didn't usually stop me working. Unfortunately that changed when I found that if you try to play a spatial sound by clicking the 'playing' checkbox on an AudioStreamPlayer3D the editor will crash. I suspect this is because the 3D audio relies on the camera position and whatever's causing the previous error has probably caused a null reference to something 

**Steps to reproduce:**

- Load the project I've attached
- Select the viewport node and then clear the world it currently has set (You might start seeing 'scene/resources/world.cpp:125 - ' Condition !E ' is true.' errors)
- Save the scene and close it
- Load the scene
- create a new blank scene and move the camera around, you should see lots of this error: 
scene/3d/camera.cpp:601 - Condition ' !is_inside_world() ' is true. Returned: Vector<Plane>()

The issue with audio is that spatial play back in a scene where this error is happening will cause godot to crash


**Link to minimal example project:**
[viewport_bug.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/1327398/viewport_bug.zip)

<!-- Optional but very welcome. You can drag and drop a zip archive to upload it. -->

data.title: Invalid set index 'index'(on base:'Dictionary')
Bucket fill will now incrementally process the queue on preview mode
data.body:
This changes the way the bucket fill works in preview mode, instead of processing it fully always it will add a limit of 1024, and will keep processing on the next process if it didn't finish before. This prevents small freezes with the editor when you have a big tilemap and you use the bucket fill tool.

This is how it works with this PR:
![bucket_fill](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10578225/30783119-3a92c2c2-a114-11e7-9fbc-bc933b08584b.gif)

This doesn't affect the way it works on non-preview mode.

data.title: Goto to parent on left arrow in tree with single column
data.body: Goto to parent on left arrow in tree with single column as discussed in #11328

data.title: Incorrect default UV map on CubeMesh
data.body:
**Operating system or device, Godot version, GPU Model and driver (if graphics related):** Windows 10, Godot Git https://github.com/godotengine/godot/commit/d3ea92257dc48dece18ae142fa2739601b711137, NVIDIA

**Issue description:** The default UV map of the CubeMesh (as part of MeshInstance) does not fit the mesh (the texture also is stretched in a non-uniform manner). See below for an example with `icon.png` applied to a CubeMesh:

![Incorrect UV on CubeMesh](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/180032/30781723-a554796a-a124-11e7-9250-4d8e67e19c49.png)

**Steps to reproduce:** Create a CubeMesh from a MeshInstance, then create a SpatialMaterial and apply an albedo texture to it.

___

**Workaround:** To obtain a correct UV mapping, set the Uv1 scale to `(3, 2, 1)`. It will then look like this:

![Correct UV on CubeMesh](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/180032/30781791-d49b9afe-a125-11e7-9281-726dd8904d0c.png)

data.title: Removed directory scan from project load
data.body:
After discussing this with @akien-mga today, changed the project loading code so the loop at the end which scans through each parent folder of our given path, to only loading a project at the given path.

If you start Godot without specifying a path and if no datapack can be found, it will only check for a project in the current working folder.
If you start Godot with a path (as the editor does after selecting a project) and it can't find a datapack, it will only open a project from the specified location.

It will no longer scan through parent folders.

This is a basic but potentially far reaching change so before merging I would suggest this is discussed further and tested well.

I've also removed some of the output I had added for debugging purposes as they were confusing people.

*Bugsquad edit:* Fixes #7764.

data.title: Removed get_resource_dir from osx platform
data.body: As discussed, removing get_resource_dir all together. Originally added this when I was fixing loading the right pack file on OSX, wasn't being used and caused all sorts of issues. Had already been commented out, now removed :)

data.title: Get-function for VehicleWheel::m_skidInfo
data.body:
Linux, seems platform independent
Godot 3.0-alpha d3ea922

**Issue description:**
I can't seem to find any way to fetch VehicleWheel::m_skidInfo in GDscript. This seem to be rather useful if creating a vehicle-based game.


**Steps to reproduce:**
Use editor, try to find m_skidInfo value of a VehicleWheel

I'm not sure this should be considered an issue but was asked to post here by Odino on IRC.
